segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)

segment.source: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)
segment.target: Enable .NET Framework 3.5 by using Control Panel and Windows Update (Windows 8 only)

segment.source: For an installation of Windows 8 that has an Internet connection, the easiest way to add .NET Framework 3.5 is to download the required files by using Control Panel and Windows Update.
segment.target: For an installation of Windows 8 that has an Internet connection, the easiest way to add .NET Framework 3.5 is to download the required files by using Control Panel and Windows Update.

segment.source: If the PC or server is behind a firewall or uses a proxy server, see KB900935 - How the Windows Update client determines which proxy server to use to connect to the Windows Update Web site.
segment.target: If the PC or server is behind a firewall or uses a proxy server, see KB900935 - How the Windows Update client determines which proxy server to use to connect to the Windows Update Web site.

segment.source: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.
segment.target: The current user must be a member of the local Administrators group to add or remove Windows features.

segment.source: On the Start Screen type turn on windows features, select Settings in the Search pane, and click on Turn Windows features on or off.
segment.target: On the Start Screen type turn on windows features, select Settings in the Search pane, and click on Turn Windows features on or off.

segment.source: The wizard will search for required files and then prompt you to download the files through Windows Update.
segment.target: The wizard will search for required files and then prompt you to download the files through Windows Update.

segment.source: In Windows Update, select Download Files.
segment.target: In Windows Update, select Download Files.

segment.source: After the wizard completes, click Finish.
segment.target: After the wizard completes, click Finish.
